run:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml423(title) msgid "Set Object Storage Quotas" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml424(para) msgid "" "Object Storage quotas were introduced in Swift 1.8 (OpenStack Grizzly). " "There are currently two categories of quotas for Object Storage:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml429(para) msgid "" "Container Quotas: Limits the total size (in bytes) or number of objects that" " can be stored in a single container." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml433(para) msgid "" "Account Quotas: Limits the total size (in bytes) that a user has available " "in the Object Storage service." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml437(para) msgid "" "In order to take advantage of either container quotas or account quotas, " "your Object Storage proxy server must have container_quotas or " "account_quotas (or both) added to the [pipeline:main] pipeline." " Each quota type also requires its own section in the proxy-" "server.conf file:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml451(para) msgid "" "To view and update Object Storage quotas, use the swift command" " provided by the python-swiftclient package. Any user included " "in the project can view the quotas placed on their project. In order to " "update Object Storage quotas on a project, you must have the role of " "ResellerAdmin in the project that the quota is being applied to." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml457(para) msgid "To view account quotas placed on a project:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml467(para) msgid "To apply or update account quotas on a project:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml470(para) msgid "For example, to place a 5 GB quota on an account:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml473(para) msgid "To verify the quota, run the command again:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml486(title) msgid "Set Block Storage quotas" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml487(para) msgid "" "As an administrative user, you can update the Block Storage Service quotas " "for a tenant, as well as update the quota defaults for a new tenant." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml492(caption) msgid "Block Storage Quota Descriptions" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml504(para) msgid "gigabytes" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml507(para) msgid "Number of volume gigabytes allowed per tenant." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml512(para) msgid "snapshots" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml515(para) msgid "Number of Block Storage snapshots allowed per tenant." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml521(para) msgid "volumes" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml524(para) msgid "Number of Block Storage volumes allowed per tenant." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml532(title) msgid "View and update Block Storage quotas for a tenant (project)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml534(para) msgid "" "As an administrative user, you can use the commands, which " "are provided by the python-cinderclient package, to view " "and update tenant quotas." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml539(title) msgid "To view and update default Block Storage quota values" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml554(para) msgid "" "To update a default value for a new tenant, update the property in the " "/etc/cinder/cinder.conf file." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml560(title) msgid "To view Block Storage quotas for a tenant" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml562(para) msgid "View quotas for the tenant, as follows:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml576(title) msgid "To update Compute service quotas" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml583(replaceable) msgid "NewValue" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml600(title) msgid "User Management" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml601(para) msgid "" "The command line tools for managing users are inconvenient to use directly. " "They require issuing multiple commands to complete a single task, and they " "use UUIDs rather than symbolic names for many items. In practice, humans " "typically do not use these tools directly. Fortunately, the OpenStack " "Dashboard provides a reasonable interface to this. In addition, many sites " "write custom tools for local needs to enforce local policies and provide " "levels of self service to users that aren't currently available with " "packaged tools." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml613(title) msgid "Creating New Users" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml614(para) msgid "To create a user, you need the following information:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml618(para) msgid "Username" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml621(para) msgid "Email address" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml624(para) msgid "Password" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml627(para) msgid "Primary project" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml630(para) msgid "Role" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml633(para) msgid "" "Username and email address are self-explanatory, though your site may have " "local conventions you should observe. Setting and changing passwords in the " "Identity Service requires administrative privileges. As of the Folsom " "release, users cannot change their own passwords. This is a large driver for" " creating local custom tools, and must be kept in mind when assigning and " "distributing passwords. The primary project is simply the first project the " "user is associated with and must exist prior to creating the user. Role is " "almost always going to be "member". Out of the box, OpenStack comes with " "two roles defined:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml646(para) msgid ""member": a typical user." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml649(para) msgid "" ""admin": an administrative super user which has full permissions across " "all projects and should be used with great care." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml654(para) msgid "It is possible to define other roles, but doing so is uncommon." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml656(para) msgid "" "Once you've gathered this information, creating the user in the Dashboard is" " just another web form similar to what we've seen before and can be found on" " the "Users" link in the "Admin" navigation bar and then clicking the " ""Create User" button at the top right." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml661(para) msgid "" "Modifying users is also done from this "Users" page. If you have a large " "number of users, this page can get quite crowded. The "Filter" search box " "at the top of the page can be used to limit the users listing. A form very " "similar to the user creation dialog can be pulled up by selecting "Edit" " "from the actions drop down menu at the end of the line for the user you are " "modifying." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml670(title) msgid "Associating Users with Projects" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml671(para) msgid "" "Many sites run with users being associated with only one project. This is a " "more conservative and simpler choice both for administration and for users. " "Administratively if a user reports a problem with an instance or quota it is" " obvious which project this relates to as well. Users needn't worry about " "what project they are acting in if they are only in one project. However, " "note that, by default, any user can affect the resources of any other user " "within their project. It is also possible to associate users with multiple " "projects if that makes sense for your organization." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml682(para) msgid "" "Associating existing users with an additional project or removing them from " "an older project is done from the "Projects" page of the Dashboard by " "selecting the "Modify Users" from the "Actions" column:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml692(para) msgid "" "Edit Project Members tab of the dashboard, from which " "you can perform actions on users." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml697(para) msgid "" "From this view you can do a number of useful and a few dangerous things." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml699(para) msgid "" "The first column of this form, titled "All Users", will include a list of " "all the users in your cloud who are not already associated with this project" " and the second all the users who are. These can be quite long, but can be " "limited by typing a substring of the user name you are looking for in the " "filter field at the top of the column." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml706(para) msgid "" "From here, click the + icon to add users to the project. " "Click the - to remove them." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml709(para) msgid "" "The dangerous possibility comes in the ability to change member roles. This " "is the drop down list after the user name in the Project " "Members list. In virtually all cases this value should be set to " ""Member". This example purposefully show and administrative user where " "this value is "admin"." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml714(para) msgid "" "The "admin" is global not per project so granting a user the admin role in" " any project gives the administrative rights across the whole cloud." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml717(para) msgid "" "Typical use is to only create administrative users in a single project, by " "convention the "admin" project which is created by default during cloud " "setup. If your administrative users also use the cloud to launch and manage " "instances it is strongly recommended that you use separate user accounts for" " administrative access and normal operations and that they be in distinct " "projects." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml726(title) msgid "Customizing Authorization" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml727(para) msgid "" "The default authorization settings only allow " "administrative users to create resources on behalf of a different project. " "OpenStack handles two kind of authorization policies:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml733(para) msgid "" "Operation-based: policies specify access " "criteria for specific operations, possibly with fine-grained control over " "specific attributes." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml741(para) msgid "" "Resource-based: whether access to a " "specific resource might be granted or not according to the permissions " "configured for the resource (currently available only for the network " "resource). The actual authorization policies enforced in an OpenStack " "service vary from deployment to deployment." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml752(para) msgid "" "The policy engine reads entries from the policy.json file. The " "actual location of this file might vary from distribution to distribution, " "for nova it is typically in /etc/nova/policy.json. You can " "update entries while the system is running, and you do not have to restart " "services. Currently the only way to update such policies is to edit the " "policy file." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml761(para) msgid "" "The OpenStack service's policy engine matches a policy directly. A rule " "indicates evaluation of the elements of such policies. For instance, in a " "compute:create: [["rule:admin_or_owner"]] statement, the " "policy is compute:create, and the rule is " "admin_or_owner." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml768(para) msgid "" "Policies are triggered by an OpenStack policy engine whenever one of them " "matches an OpenStack API operation or a specific attribute being used in a " "given operation. For instance, the engine tests the " "create:compute policy every time a user sends a POST " "/v2/{tenant_id}/servers request to the OpenStack Compute API server. " "Policies can be also related to specific API " "extensions. For instance, if a user needs an extension like " "compute_extension:rescue the attributes defined by the provider" " extensions trigger the rule test for that operation." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml781(para) msgid "" "An authorization policy can be composed by one or more rules. If more rules " "are specified, evaluation policy is successful if any of the rules evaluates" " successfully; if an API operation matches multiple policies, then all the " "policies must evaluate successfully. Also, authorization rules are " "recursive. Once a rule is matched, the rule(s) can be resolved to another " "rule, until a terminal rule is reached. These are the rules defined:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml792(para) msgid "" "Role-based rules: evaluate successfully " "if the user submitting the request has the specified role. For instance " ""role:admin"is successful if the user submitting the request " "is an administrator." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml799(para) msgid "" "Field-based rules: evaluate successfully " "if a field of the resource specified in the current request matches a " "specific value. For instance "field:networks:shared=True" is " "successful if the attribute shared of the network resource is set to true." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml807(para) msgid "" "Generic rules: compare an attribute in " "the resource with an attribute extracted from the user's security " "credentials and evaluates successfully if the comparison is successful. For " "instance "tenant_id:%(tenant_id)s" is successful if the " "tenant identifier in the resource is equal to the tenant identifier of the " "user submitting the request." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml816(para) msgid "" "Here are snippets of the default nova policy.json file:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml820(emphasis) msgid "[1]" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml821(emphasis) msgid "[2]" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml837(emphasis) msgid "[3]" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml840(para) msgid "" "[1] Shows a rule which evaluates successfully if the current user is an " "administrator or the owner of the resource specified in the request (tenant " "identifier is equal)." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml843(para) msgid "" "[2] Shows the default policy which is always evaluated if an API operation " "does not match any of the policies in policy.json." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml846(para) msgid "" "[3] Shows a policy restricting the ability of manipulating flavors to " "administrators using the Admin API only." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml848(para) msgid "" "In some cases, some operations should be restricted to administrators only. " "Therefore, as a further example, let us consider how this sample policy file" " could be modified in a scenario where we enable users to create their own " "flavors:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml855(title) msgid "Users that Disrupt Other Users" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml856(para) msgid "" "Users on your cloud can disrupt other users, sometimes intentionally and " "maliciously and other times by accident. Understanding the situation allows " "you to make a better decision on how to handle the disruption." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml860(para) msgid "" "For example: A group of users have instances that are utilizing a large " "amount of compute resources for very compute-intensive tasks. This is " "driving the load up on compute nodes and affecting other users. In this " "situation, review your user use cases. You may find that high compute " "scenarios are common and should then plan for proper segregation in your " "cloud such as host aggregation or regions." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml866(para) msgid "" "Another example is a user consuming a very large amount of bandwidth. Again," " the key is to understand what the user is doing. If they naturally need a " "high amount of bandwidth, you might have to limit their transmission rate as" " to not affect other users or move them to an area with more bandwidth " "available. On the other hand, maybe the user's instance has been hacked and " "is part of a botnet launching DDOS attacks. Resolution to this issue is the " "same as if any other server on your network has been hacked. Contact the " "user and give them time to respond. If they don't respond, shut the instance" " down." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml875(para) msgid "" "A final example is if a user is hammering cloud resources repeatedly. " "Contact the user and learn what they are trying to do. Maybe they don't " "understand that what they're doing is inappropriate or maybe there is an " "issue with the resource they are trying to access that is causing their " "requests to queue or lag." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml884(para) msgid "" "One key element of systems administration that is often overlooked is that " "end users are the reason why systems administrators exist. Don't go the BOFH" " route and terminate every user who causes an alert to go off. Work with " "them to understand what they're trying to accomplish and see how your " "environment can better assist them in achieving their goals. Meet your users" " needs by organizing your users into projects, applying policies, managing " "quotas, and working with them." msgstr "" #. Put one translator per line, in the form of NAME , YEAR1, YEAR2 #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_projects_users.xml0(None) msgid "translator-credits" msgstr ""

commit_message:
Correct swift proxy service name

Swift proxy service is named swift-proxy on ubuntu distribution, and
openstack-swift-proxy on suse and redhat. But there are some places
use incorrect name for service operations, they should be fixed.

Change-Id: I784e2c290833592cda7e1a2de737787fd739baee
Closes-Bug: #1293901
Closes-Bug: #1293907
backport: havana

commit_message:
Apply service name conventions for Compute

There are several instances of "Compute Service" and "compute service"
in the upstream documentation. As was recently clarified in the docs
mailing list, these should be "Compute service/s". This patch corrects
all untagged instances inside normal <para> blocks.

Change-Id: Idcd7aafa0ce463e70635cb1c883a2476c1d97b5e
Partial-Bug: #1217503

commit_message:
trust creation allowed with empty roles list

The docs state "A project_id may not be specified without at least
one role, and vice versa.", however /OS-TRUST/trusts does allow you
to create a trust with an empty roles list and project_id specified.

This results in 401 responses whenever you try to consume the trust,
because there are no roles for the trustee on the authorized project.

This patch will add a check in trust creation to ensure at least one
role exists if project_id is supplied.

Change-Id: Iebad0b6b7ed62a029d1e50afb003679bafb1655d
Closes-Bug: #1214064
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/62/69162/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_create_trust_project_no_roles(self): ref = self.new_trust_ref( trustor_user_id=self.user_id, trustee_user_id=self.trustee_user_id, project_id=self.project_id) del ref['id'] self.post('/OS-TRUST/trusts', body={'trust': ref}, expected_status=400)

commit_message:
Fix the default rpc policy value

Before, each time a service that use ceilometer.publisher.rpc start this
annoying message appear because the default value is not the correct.

WARNING ceilometer.publisher.rpc [-] Publishing policy is unknown (wait) force to default
WARNING ceilometer.publisher.rpc [-] Publishing policy is unknown (wait) force to default

This patch set the correct default (to default inteads of wait), and check in tests
that the expected logger method is called.

Fixes bug #1245965

Change-Id: I41b9461359c7b0b17eb8e9dad1772bafdc3554fc
(cherry picked from commit 30ecd2f76633b8854401c6254210aaa5a7920be0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/36/80036/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.policy = options.get('policy', ['default'])[-1]
deleted_lines: self.policy = options.get('policy', ['wait'])[-1]

commit_message:
VMware: fix image snapshot with attached volume

A snapshot of a instance with an attached volume will result in
the wrong volume being uploaded to glance. The reason for this
are as follows:
1. the last image in the list of images would be exported
2. the base image would not be exported but the first found

The same happens with a VM rescue if there is a cinder volume
attached.

The solution is to search for an image that contains the instance
UUID.

Change-Id: Ic85b0ffd4f1c34f10d07b1a198eaad2030803d6f
Closes-bug: #1243193
(cherry picked from commit 9ceee09594cd35c264cab3e3b3d1d80aaa3fdbc4)

Conflicts:

	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: I6b9febbfe4e4e6ecf5d31a2b09a4319b07696f9c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/20/72020/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def get_vmdk_path_and_adapter_type(hardware_devices): vmdk_file_path = device.backing.fileName vmdk_controler_key = device.controllerKey

revisions:

delete() method of attach_interfaces API is routed when specifying

does not affect the test behaviors because the tests do not check

commit_message:
Fix HTTP methods for test_attach_interfaces

delete() method of attach_interfaces API is routed when specifying
"DELETE" as HTTP method, but some tests specify "POST". This bug
does not affect the test behaviors because the tests do not check
API router behaviors and just checks delete() method behaviors.

However, this patch fixes this bug because the bug confuses the
API router behaviors.

Change-Id: I8e862cbd58da820eb336d3ef41185e16f63bb6be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/16/76116/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: req.method = 'DELETE' req.method = 'DELETE' req.method = 'DELETE'
deleted_lines: req.method = 'POST' req.method = 'POST' req.method = 'POST'

added_lines: <para>Bob is very concerned about instance isolation since the users in a public cloud represent anyone with a credit card, meaning they are inherently untrusted. Bob has just started hiring the team that will deploy the cloud, so he can tailor his candidate search for specific areas of expertise. With this in mind, Bob chooses a hypervisor based on its technical features, certifications, and community support. KVM has an EAL 4+ common criteria rating, with a labeled security protection profile (LSPP) to provide added assurance for instance isolation. This, combined with the strong support for KVM within the OpenStack community drives Bob's decision to use KVM.</para>

Sort requirement files in alphabetical order

in the requirement files easily. We also enforce the check in pep8.

commit_message:
Improve LOG messages in ConductorManager

* replace LOG.debug with LOG.info in some places
* clarify wording, and
* move a few messages so they are logged only when performing the action
  (eg, after state checks and lock acquisition).

Change-Id: I598918611b2310e7b8fb7bc3ce198f072b555318

subject: Send exists notification after completion of certain operations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-04 16:26:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/94c2f0a4c9e03f539029e90776f4ae2f0f32f7b3', 'message': 'Send exists notification after completion of
certain operations

Nova currently sends exists notifications only when the
resize/resize-revert/rebuild/rescue operations begin. When these
operations span audit periods, this causes some values from the period
between the time that the previous audit period ended to the time at
which the rebuild/resize finishes, to be ignored. This should be fixed
by sending an exists notification just after the operations finish.

Change-Id: If8c7cdbcc5e18875bbeb30ecc13da3d14a9f8252
Closes-Bug: #1286992
'}]
commit_message:
Send exists notification after completion of
certain operations

Nova currently sends exists notifications only when the
resize/resize-revert/rebuild/rescue operations begin. When these
operations span audit periods, this causes some values from the period
between the time that the previous audit period ended to the time at
which the rebuild/resize finishes, to be ignored. This should be fixed
by sending an exists notification just after the operations finish.

Change-Id: If8c7cdbcc5e18875bbeb30ecc13da3d14a9f8252
Closes-Bug: #1286992

subject: Make @refresh_cache decorator take update_cells argument
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-06 08:57:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/api.py', 'nova/tests/network/test_api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9937457be1481bd858052ee2cc434aa9165a93bd', 'message': 'Make @refresh_cache decorator take update_cells argument

A recent change modifies the @refresh_cache decorator so that it only
updates instance cache if needed. For the get_instance_nw_info()
method to take advantage of this, it must use the decorator instead of
calling update_instance_cache_with_nw_info() directly. To do this, the
decorator must be modified to take the update_cells argument.

Related blueprint: smarter-network-cache-update

Change-Id: Id56fcb87458a88241f3929de7312da18b9cf5b9f
'}]
commit_message:
Make @refresh_cache decorator take update_cells argument

A recent change modifies the @refresh_cache decorator so that it only
updates instance cache if needed. For the get_instance_nw_info()
method to take advantage of this, it must use the decorator instead of
calling update_instance_cache_with_nw_info() directly. To do this, the
decorator must be modified to take the update_cells argument.

Related blueprint: smarter-network-cache-update

Change-Id: Id56fcb87458a88241f3929de7312da18b9cf5b9f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/52/78552/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: class JournalDBAPITest(HeatTestCase): def setUp(self): super(DBAPIWatchDataTest, self).setUp() self.ctx = utils.dummy_context() utils.setup_dummy_db() utils.reset_dummy_db() self.template = create_raw_template(self.ctx) self.user_creds = create_user_creds(self.ctx) self.stack = create_stack(self.ctx, self.template, self.user_creds) self.watch_rule = create_watch_rule(self.ctx, self.stack) self.stack_id = 'af58ea95-e4f2-4fbb-83b8-b8df14237822' def test_journal(self): self.assertIsNotNone(db_api.journal_create(self.ctx, self.stack_id)) self.assertTrue(db_api.journal_exists(self.ctx, self.stack_id)) self.assertFalse(db_api.journal_has_entry(self.ctx, self.stack_id, 'test_journal_add')) db_api.journal_add(self.ctx, self.stack_id, 'test_journal_add') self.assertTrue(db_api.journal_has_entry(self.ctx, self.stack_id, 'test_journal_add')) self.assertEqual(1, db_api.journal_count_entries(self.ctx, self.tack_id)) db_api.journal_reset(self.ctx, self.stack_id) self.assertEqual(0, db_api.journal_count_entries(self.ctx, self.tack_id)) self.assertFalse(db_api.journal_has_entry(self.ctx, self.stack_id, 'test_journal_add')) self.assertTrue(db_api.journal_delete(self.ctx, self.stack_id)) self.assertFalse(db_api.journal_exists(self.ctx, self.stack_id))

commit_message:
Rename HARestarter to HARebuilder

The original name is misleading because the instance isn't
just restarted but rebuilt from scratch.

OS::Heat::HARestarter is added to the default environment
for backwards compatibility.

Closes-Bug: #1283956
Change-Id: I09001092194614773b092691dfce44b0c97f621f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/03/75803/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class Rebuilder(signal_responder.SignalResponder): super(Rebuilder, self).handle_create() self.stack.rebuild_resource(victim.name) 'OS::Heat::HARebuilder': Rebuilder,
deleted_lines: class Restarter(signal_responder.SignalResponder): super(Restarter, self).handle_create() self.stack.restart_resource(victim.name) 'OS::Heat::HARestarter': Restarter,

commit_message:
Add XML capability to extra_DHCP_options extension

Adds declaration of plurals and singulars to the extra_DHCP_options API
extension. This enables the proper processing of XML requests

Closes-Bug: #1272587
Change-Id: Ib66a828b35f8e6396e3ee3762052bcabac729fbf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/44/68544/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: attr.PLURALS.update({'extra_dhcp_opts': 'extra_dhcp_opt'})

commit_message:
enable db migration for old NVP plugins

These plugins are backward compatible. Let the migration scripts run if these
plugins are used.

Closes-Bug: 1285841
Change-Id: I58b5cf1bf26ae0e0370b7905203a4e0f6b22460f

commit_message:
Glance: Make API bind host and port configurable

Make the following Glance API params configurable:

* bind_host
* bind_port

Change-Id: I51bb881ea8ac54080113a7272dc50ce96d7ba02c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/17/77617/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {{glance.api-bind-host}} # Default is '0.0.0.0' bind_host = {{api-bind-host}} {{glance.api-bind-host}} {{#glance.api-bind-port}} bind_port = {{glance.api-bind-port}} {{/glance.api-bind-port}} {{^glance.api-bind-port}} # If undefined, set to '9292'{{/glance.api-bind-port}}
deleted_lines: bind_host = 0.0.0.0

subject: VMware copy image handler
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-18 01:01:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/182ea8a56ed8db238205f5e26aa8f5eb285cd9c5', 'message': 'VMware: Copy image handler

The VMware driver should take advantage of the Glance VMware
datastore storage backend in order to avoid a download of the
image from the Glance store to the VMware datastore.
This patch is the implementation of a new image handler using
the location URL provided by the V2 API of Glance to directly
copy the file on the VMware datastore in order to spawn the instance.
If this copy fails, the download image handler will be used.

The patch partially implements bp: image-multiple-location
and bp: nova-image-zero-copy

The next step would be to use directly the image without any copy.

Change-Id: I6c4231c70ef4e6a95817fdb3baa2725837f2003e
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-18 01:01:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6edadf70ea7d6a5c42d91c51c9c8f4ba59204fa7', 'message': 'VMware: Copy image handler

commit_message:
VMware copy image handler

The VMware driver should take advantage of the Glance VMware
datastore storage backend in order to avoid a download of the
image from the Glance store to the VMware datastore.
This patch is the implementation of a copy image handler  using
the location URL provided by the V2 API of Glance to directly
copy the file on the VMware datastore in order to spawn the VM.

The patch partially implements bp: vmware-clone-image-handler

Change-Id: I6c4231c70ef4e6a95817fdb3baa2725837f2003e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/06/67606/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: vmware_copy_handler = nova.virt.vmwareapi.copy_imagehandler:CopyImageHandler

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-11 08:23:11.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/test_api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/577b73c30355bc37e551df7725bff90472b3e2a8', 'message': 'Run neutron-maintained api tests

commit_message:
Run neutron-maintained api tests

This change adds support for reusing Neutron-maintained api tests
that can can be parametized to use the Tempest rest clients.
The intention is that api tests be maintained in the Neutron
source tree going forward by Neutron developers.

Some outstanding questions may be:

 - Is it desirable for Neutron to maintain api tests?
 - Is it acceptable for Tempest to depend on the Neutron
   source tree?

This change has been submitted as a POC for now - it is not a
candidate for merge at this time.

Change-Id: I988cc5546a5b7266a3e098545241cb0e98962932

added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import testscenarios from neutron.tests.unit import test_plugin_api from tempest import exceptions from tempest import test #NOTE(marun) Scenario generation won't work with nose. load_tests = testscenarios.load_tests_apply_scenarios def get_scenarios(): """ Generate scenarios with the tempest rest client for both xml and json formats. """ scenarios = [] for fmt in ['json', 'xml']: manager = test.BaseTestCase.get_client_manager(interface=fmt) client = test_plugin_api.TempestRestClient(manager.network_client, exceptions.NotFound) scenarios.append(('tempest_%s' % fmt, {'client': client})) return scenarios class TestNeutronApi(test_plugin_api.TestApi): scenarios = get_scenarios()

commit_message:
Keep py3.X compatibility for urllib

Use six.moves.urllib.parse instead of urllib

Partial-Bug: #1280105

Change-Id: If035fbdde2a956fd15e27554dbb4b3e76c6fe2dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/46/74046/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six.moves.urllib.parse as urlparse env['PATH_INFO'] = urlparse.unquote(path_info)
deleted_lines: import urllib env['PATH_INFO'] = urllib.unquote(path_info)

commit_message:
Import six.StringIO

six.StringIO
This is an fake file object for textual data. It is an alias for
StringIO.StringIO in Python 2 and io.StringIO in Python 3.

Partial Implement: blueprint tempest-py33-support

Change-Id: I3e72e42d8344ce05dc67247cdd952832fddc51d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/40/78540/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six image_file = six.StringIO(('*' * 1024)) image_file = six.StringIO('*' * size) image_file = six.StringIO('*' * 42) image_file = six.StringIO('*' * size)
deleted_lines: import cStringIO as StringIO image_file = StringIO.StringIO(('*' * 1024)) image_file = StringIO.StringIO('*' * size) image_file = StringIO.StringIO('*' * 42) image_file = StringIO.StringIO('*' * size)

subject: project_id is not actually required to use the client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-06 00:34:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/3a892e51f758895452d7eaa2f5a32bf206228f84', 'message': "project_id is not actually required to use the client

This patch makes project_id optional (if one passes in tenant_id). This
change is required so that neutron doesn't have to pass a random string
in for project_id.

Change-Id: I32a86adbc9124b788cdf867102007eca6a642d5d
Closes-bug: #1288491
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-06 00:46:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/09767b47272033e9a5a9637725b9023516dc7996', 'message': "project_id is not actually required to use the client

This patch makes project_id optional (note one would need to pass in tenant_id).
This change is required so that neutron doesn't have to pass a random string
in for project_id as want to leverage bypass_url to avoid unnecessary access
to keystone.

Change-Id: I32a86adbc9124b788cdf867102007eca6a642d5d
Closes-bug: #1288491
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-06 03:24:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/d2f7b0ae3dc8c5bff40a2bb8ca173a7169aee204', 'message': "project_id is not actually required to use the client

This patch makes project_id optional (note one would need to pass in tenant_id).
This change is required so that neutron doesn't have to pass a project_id if
we want to leverage bypass_url to avoid unnecessary access to keystone.

commit_message:
project_id is not actually required to use the client

This patch makes project_id optional (note one would need to pass in tenant_id).
This change is required so that neutron doesn't have to pass a project_id if
we want to leverage bypass_url to avoid unnecessary access to keystone.

Change-Id: I32a86adbc9124b788cdf867102007eca6a642d5d
Closes-bug: #1288491

commit_message:
Stop volume leaking even if an error is occurred

In some test, if an error is occurred in setUpClass(), some resources
are not deleted because of tearDownClass() is not called.
This commit fixes it.

Partially Implements: blueprint stop-leaking

Change-Id: I6839645285da4ecd59e536b6413a67f0acaf7d6c

commit_message:
Make sure "volumeId" in req body on volume actions

We should check whether the parameter "volumeId" is in request body while
attaching a volume to an instance and while swapping volume.

Change-Id: I0be2ae4c80615c0304cd1a0d8ca0a4282a0867c7
Closes-Bug: #1257135
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/10/59610/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_attach_volume_without_volumeId(self): self.stubs.Set(compute_api.API, 'attach_volume', fake_attach_volume) body = { 'volumeAttachment': { 'device': None } } req = webob.Request.blank('/v2/servers/id/os-volume_attachments') req.method = 'POST' req.body = jsonutils.dumps({}) req.headers['content-type'] = 'application/json' req.environ['nova.context'] = self.context self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, self.attachments.create, req, FAKE_UUID, body) def _test_swap(self, uuid=FAKE_UUID_A, body=None): if not body: body = {'volumeAttachment': {'volumeId': FAKE_UUID_B, 'device': '/dev/fake'}} else: body = body def test_swap_volume_without_volumeId(self): self.ext_mgr.extensions['os-volume-attachment-update'] = True body = {'volumeAttachment': {'device': '/dev/fake'}} self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, self._test_swap(body=body))
deleted_lines: def _test_swap(self, uuid=FAKE_UUID_A): body = {'volumeAttachment': {'volumeId': FAKE_UUID_B, 'device': '/dev/fake'}}

subject: Fix the explanations of HTTPNotFound response
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-27 01:36:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/rescue.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/admin_actions.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/shelve.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/os_networks.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/server_diagnostics.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/services.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/extended_volumes.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/floating_ips_bulk.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/multinic.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/os_tenant_networks.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/security_group_default_rules.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/services.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/networks_associate.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/console_output.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/16e360d3a9183e9fd2b3dc163fe3e1ce4ec18e8b', 'message': 'Fix the explanations of HTTPNotFound response

Nova wsgi framework gets "explanation" from HTTPNotFound exception and
outputs it into a response body as "message" attribute. Now some error
explanations are passed to HTTPNotFound exception without explanation
argument and they are not output to a response body. As the result,
the default message "The resource could not be found." of wsgi library
are output to a response body instead.

This patch fixes them to output right message to a response body.

Change-Id: I80d3a2da6258e94c485ce024eb310a63bcf39773
Closes-Bug: #1285437
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the explanations of HTTPNotFound response

Nova wsgi framework gets "explanation" from HTTPNotFound exception and
outputs it into a response body as "message" attribute. Now some error
explanations are passed to HTTPNotFound exception without explanation
argument and they are not output to a response body. As the result,
the default message "The resource could not be found." of wsgi library
are output to a response body instead.

This patch fixes them to output right message to a response body.

Change-Id: I80d3a2da6258e94c485ce024eb310a63bcf39773
Closes-Bug: #1285437
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/24/76724/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: msg = _('Instance not found') raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=msg) msg = _('Unable to get console') raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=msg)
deleted_lines: raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(_('Instance not found')) raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(_('Unable to get console'))

commit_message:
Fix broken API os-migrations

The return is not what we are expecting:
  migration-list: 'unicode' object has no attribute 'iteritems'

The conversion of the object nova.objects.MigrationList into a list
is not applied automatically.

Change-Id: I1579b1baf62275bf448f23be9465d4e9bc11ed85
Closes-Bug: #1260249
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/17/61717/30 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return {'migrations': [m for m in migrations]}
deleted_lines: return {'migrations': migrations}

commit_message:
Complete moving Keystone setup out of keystone_data.sh

* Move remaining role creation to create_keystone_accounts()
* Move glance creation to create_glance_accounts()
* Move nova/ec2/s3 creation to create_nova_accounts()
* Move ceilometer creation to create_ceilometer_accounts()
* Move tempest creation to create_tempest_accounts()
* Convert moved code to use OpenStackClient for setup
* files/keystone_data.sh is removed

Note that the SERVICE_TENANT and ADMIN_ROLE lookups in the other service
implementations are not necessary with OSC, all operations can be done
using names rather than requiring IDs.

Change-Id: I4283ca0036ae39fd44ed2eed834b69d78e4f8257
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/66/79366/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Setup OpenStackclient token-flow auth create_glance_accounts if is_service_enabled swift; then # Begone token-flow auth # Set up password-flow auth creds now that keystone is bootstrapped
deleted_lines: # Do the keystone-specific bits from keystone_data.sh export OS_SERVICE_TOKEN=$SERVICE_TOKEN export OS_SERVICE_ENDPOINT=$SERVICE_ENDPOINT # Add temporarily to make openstackclient work if is_service_enabled swift || is_service_enabled s-proxy; then # ``keystone_data.sh`` creates services, admin and demo users, and roles. ADMIN_PASSWORD=$ADMIN_PASSWORD SERVICE_TENANT_NAME=$SERVICE_TENANT_NAME SERVICE_PASSWORD=$SERVICE_PASSWORD \ SERVICE_TOKEN=$SERVICE_TOKEN SERVICE_ENDPOINT=$SERVICE_ENDPOINT SERVICE_HOST=$SERVICE_HOST \ S3_SERVICE_PORT=$S3_SERVICE_PORT KEYSTONE_CATALOG_BACKEND=$KEYSTONE_CATALOG_BACKEND \ DEVSTACK_DIR=$TOP_DIR ENABLED_SERVICES=$ENABLED_SERVICES \ bash -x $FILES/keystone_data.sh # Set up auth creds now that keystone is bootstrapped unset OS_SERVICE_TOKEN OS_SERVICE_ENDPOINT

subject: Support building wheels (PEP-427)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-07 11:33:31.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0dfae3b68df4abec099ebd631520917ee66c5fa4', 'message': 'Support building wheels (PEP-427)

Universal is used to identify pure-Python module(by bdist_wheel). For
these, it is sufficient to build a wheel with _any_ Python ABI version
and publish that to PyPI (by whatever means).

Change-Id: Ic22b78ef6434ebf888c92c0a162caeabb70edf88
'}]
commit_message:
Support building wheels (PEP-427)

Universal is used to identify pure-Python module(by bdist_wheel). For
these, it is sufficient to build a wheel with _any_ Python ABI version
and publish that to PyPI (by whatever means).

Change-Id: Ic22b78ef6434ebf888c92c0a162caeabb70edf88
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/72/71872/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [wheel] universal = 1

commit_message:
Test for the neutron api with provider extension

Add test for list, show, create and update network
based on local and vlan network type scenario.

Change-Id: Ifeea274499b4d2e4c63f9451aa9fe53252cd9165
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/42/50542/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2012 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import netaddr from tempest.api.network import base from tempest.common.utils.data_utils import rand_name from tempest import exceptions from tempest.test import attr class NetworkProviderExtJSON(base.BaseAdminNetworkTest): _interface = 'json' """ Tests the following operations in the Neutron API using the REST client for Neutron: create a network for a tenant with provider attributes list tenant's networks with provider attributes show a tenant network details update tenant's networks with provider attributes v2.0 of the Neutron API is assumed. It is also assumed that the following options are defined in the [network] section of etc/tempest.conf: tenant_network_cidr with a block of cidr's from which smaller blocks can be allocated for tenant networks tenant_network_mask_bits with the mask bits to be used to partition the block defined by tenant-network_cidr """ @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(NetworkProviderExtJSON, cls).setUpClass() cls.network = cls.create_network_with_provider_attributes() @attr(type='smoke') def test_create_update_network_with_provider_attributes(self): # Creates a network with local network type name = rand_name('network-') network_type = 'local' resp, body = self.client.create_network_with_provider_attributes( name, network_type) self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) network = body['network'] net_id = network['id'] test_network = body['network'] # Verification of network update new_name = "New_network" resp, body = self.client.update_network(net_id, new_name) self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) updated_net = body['network'] self.assertEqual(updated_net['name'], new_name) # Delete network resp, body = self.client.delete_network(net_id) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status']) @attr(type='smoke') def test_show_network_with_provider_attributes(self): # Verifies the details of a network resp, body = self.client.show_network(self.network['id']) self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) network = body['network'] self.assertEqual(self.network['id'], network['id']) self.assertEqual(self.network['name'], network['name']) @attr(type='smoke') def test_list_networks_with_provider_attributes(self): # Verify the network exists in the list of all networks resp, body = self.client.list_networks() self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) networks = body['networks'] found = None for n in networks: if (n['id'] == self.network['id']): found = n['id'] msg = "Network list doesn't contain created network" self.assertIsNotNone(found, msg) class NetworkProviderExtXML(NetworkProviderExtJSON): _interface = 'xml'

subject: VMware vSphere: Bug fixes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-15 07:46:42.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/compute/virt/vmware/vsphere_operations.py', 'ceilometer/compute/virt/vmware/inspector.py', 'ceilometer/tests/compute/virt/vmware/test_inspector.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/8026eccc36c7a2c34e247afa8a5cb3d47c0f13c7', 'message': "VMware vSphere: Bug fixes

- Fixed bugs in meter conversions i.e. converting the stat value queried
from vSphere to the one used for creating ceilometer samples.

- Switched the vSphere networking counters 'bytesTx/bytesRx' to
'transmitted/received'. The counters are synonymous, but the latter ones
are available since ESX 3.5 and former are available only in ESX 5.0
onwards.

- Added a null check in VsphereOperations._init_vm_moid_lookup_map()

Change-Id: I8691ce4ded7bdc824bd56427642f9dd87081727a
Implements: blueprint vmware-vcenter-server
"}]
commit_message:
VMware vSphere: Bug fixes

- Fixed bugs in meter conversions i.e. converting the stat value queried
from vSphere to the one used for creating ceilometer samples.

- Switched the vSphere networking counters 'bytesTx/bytesRx' to
'transmitted/received'. The counters are synonymous, but the latter ones
are available since ESX 3.5 and former are available only in ESX 5.0
onwards.

- Added a null check in VsphereOperations._init_vm_moid_lookup_map()

Change-Id: I8691ce4ded7bdc824bd56427642f9dd87081727a
Implements: blueprint vmware-vcenter-server
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/64/80764/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: fake_memory_value = 1024.0 fake_cpu_util_value * 100 vsphere_inspector.VC_NETWORK_RX_COUNTER: 1, vsphere_inspector.VC_NETWORK_TX_COUNTER: 2 1: {vnic1: 1, vnic2: 3}, 2: {vnic1: 2, vnic2: 4}, vnic1: virt_inspector.InterfaceRateStats(1024, 2048), vnic2: virt_inspector.InterfaceRateStats(3072, 4096)
deleted_lines: fake_memory_value = 1048576.0 fake_cpu_util_value vsphere_inspector.VC_NETWORK_RX_BYTES_COUNTER: 1, vsphere_inspector.VC_NETWORK_TX_BYTES_COUNTER: 2 1: {vnic1: 1000.0, vnic2: 3000.0}, 2: {vnic1: 2000.0, vnic2: 4000.0}, vnic1: virt_inspector.InterfaceRateStats(1.0, 2.0), vnic2: virt_inspector.InterfaceRateStats(3.0, 4.0)

commit_message:
Add slow tag for test_ceilometer_resource_list

This commit adds a slow tag to the ceilometer cli test
test_ceilometer_resource_list. This test is consistently among the
slowest in a gate run. (usually slower than the scenario tests) So,
this shouldn't be part of a normal gate run a cli test is just a
simple sanity check it shouldn't take minutes to execute.

Change-Id: I8aa73823d5f6558c3e378ed8a0e17e351775b8dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/36/81036/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest import test @test.attr(type='slow')

commit_message:
Default properties to the empty dict in ResourceGroup

Sets the properties of the grouped resource to {} when it's None to make
sure the resource is built properly.

Change-Id: I2938c741063159ef81a7996d203adaf466cf19c4
Closes-Bug: #1291421
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/59/79959/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_assemble_no_properties(self): templ = copy.deepcopy(template) res_def = templ["resources"]["group1"]["properties"]['resource_def'] del res_def['properties'] stack = utils.parse_stack(templ) resg = stack.resources['group1'] self.assertIsNone(resg.validate())

commit_message:
Fix InternalException raised on stack-show

Getting attributes of a OS::Nova::Server raises a 500 error if the server
doesn't exist. So stack show doesn't work. We should catch the exception
and return the default values of the output keys of the server while
getting attributes to make sure the api works.

Change-Id: If569b4d73abbce93d3c56c45a1eb284720c6e416
Closes-Bug: #1279085

deleted_lines: server = self.nova().servers.get(self.resource_id) if name == 'addresses': return server.addresses if name == 'networks': return server.networks if name == 'instance_name': return server._info.get('OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:instance_name') if name == 'accessIPv4': return server.accessIPv4 if name == 'accessIPv6': return server.accessIPv6 if name == 'show': return server._info

commit_message:
Removing unnecessary required=True options

Property with a default value should not have required=True,
since it has no effect (the default value would be used if a property
were not given, making it not required).

Change-Id: I760ed5c010c9ff3c0e4dc0fc7860f1e18147921d

Add a client for the builder

This requires the client to be in pypi and in the global requirements

- add an example usage
- add the client

Change-Id: Ib12e07db84bf6c2bee602a69925e878d34197de1

commit_message:
Remove Masked Database Backup Quota Error

removes the generic error message for backup creation failures and
instead surfaces the message returned by the api.

Change-Id: Icd8edc89e51ed998c811481e678bbf5fdbdc142e
Closes-Bug: #1291669
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/12/80112/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: msg = _('Error creating database backup.') exceptions.handle(request, msg)

commit_message:
Calculate stateless IPv6 address

In order to support stateless IPv6, neutron should calculate IPv6 address base
on IPv6 prefix and MAC address via EUI-64 specification.  This change adds
common library to calculate IPv6 address.

Partially-implements bp ipv6-two-attributes
Co-Authored-By: Xu Han Peng <xuhanp@cn.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I68ccbc42388ec760d6fead242e080822ca753913

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # @author: Dazhao Yu, dzyu@cn.ibm.com, IBM # from neutron.openstack.common import network_utils from neutron.tests import base class IPv6byEUI64TestCase(base.BaseTestCase): """Unit tests for generate IPv6 by EUI-64 operations.""" def setUp(self): super(IPv6byEUI64TestCase, self).setUp() def test_generate_IPv6_by_EUI64(self): addr = network_utils.get_ipv6_addr_by_EUI64('2001:db8::', '02:16:3e:33:44:55') self.assertEquals(addr, '2001:db8::16:3eff:fe33:4455') def test_generate_IPv6_with_bad_mac(self): bad_mac = '02:16:3e:33:44:5Z' prefix = '2001:db8::' self.assertRaises(TypeError, network_utils.get_ipv6_addr_by_EUI64, prefix, bad_mac) def test_geneate_IPv6_with_bad_prefix(self): mac = '02:16:3e:33:44:55' bad_prefix = 'dd' self.assertRaises(TypeError, network_utils.get_ipv6_addr_by_EUI64, bad_prefix, mac)

commit_message:
Remove get_resource_or_fake method in VPN panel

api/vpn.py now expands related resources now.
get_resource_or_fake method is no longer required.

Closes-Bug: #1292998
Change-Id: I45d049f7ccc3a4be7a6bfb08cbd8de650d4344de

commit_message:
Reimplement L3Agent as router's property

We implemented Neutron's L3Agent resource as Heat's RouterL3Agent resource at
once.

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61388/

However, that model can change the router_id when doing stack-update.
The bug 1272254 was caused by that model.

We discussed about how to resolve the bug 1272254 with the Heat community.
The conclusion is to remove RouterL3Agent, then to reimplement agent_id as
router's property. This model can't change router_id. So its model can resolve
the bug.

Closes-bug: #1272254
Change-Id: Id9f75920ec46ec32f3e41bdb97f89a7fd09490ec

commit_message:
Rescue API handle NotImplementedError

There are several nova virt drivers that don't implement the rescue API,
but the os compute API doesn't handle NotImplementedError,
it returns a 400 instead of a 501.

The patch add the proper logic to return a 501 instead.

Change-Id: Ia649c4dadd50985efed631ce8f3e4b212646766e
Closes-Bug: #1287367
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/36/77736/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mock @mock.patch('nova.compute.api.API.rescue') def test_rescue_raises_not_implemented(self, rescue_mock): body = dict(rescue=None) def fake_rescue(*args, **kwargs): raise NotImplementedError('not implemented') rescue_mock.side_effect = fake_rescue req = webob.Request.blank('/v2/fake/servers/test_inst/action') req.method = "POST" req.body = jsonutils.dumps(body) req.headers["content-type"] = "application/json" resp = req.get_response(self.app) self.assertEqual(resp.status_int, 501) @mock.patch('nova.compute.api.API.unrescue') def test_unrescue_raises_not_implemented(self, unrescue_mock): body = dict(unrescue=None) def fake_unrescue(*args, **kwargs): raise NotImplementedError('not implemented') unrescue_mock.side_effect = fake_unrescue req = webob.Request.blank('/v2/fake/servers/test_inst/action') req.method = "POST" req.body = jsonutils.dumps(body) req.headers["content-type"] = "application/json" resp = req.get_response(self.app) self.assertEqual(resp.status_int, 501)

commit_message:
Configure localrc for virtual-ironic tests

Add the DEVSTACK_GATE_VIRT_DRIVER option which, when set, will inject
the appropriate settings to localrc so that Nova will use the Ironic
driver and devstack will prepare the environment appropriately to test
it.

Change-Id: Ic722c871138c3cf18fc49477161e8d26c4531612
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/53/80653/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MY_ENABLED_SERVICES=$MY_ENABLED_SERVICES,ir-api,ir-cond,ironic if [ "$DEVSTACK_GATE_VIRT_DRIVER" == "ironic" ]; then echo "VIRT_DRIVER=ironic" >>localrc echo "IRONIC_BAREMETAL_BASIC_OPS=True" >>localrc fi
deleted_lines: MY_ENABLED_SERVICES=$MY_ENABLED_SERVICES,ir-api,ir-cond

commit_message:
Fix the calls of webob exception classes

The webob exception classes has "explanation" arguments but some
methods calls the classes with invalid arguments. This patch fixes
them.
In addition, this patch changes the error handling of agent_build
_create() because the method raises AgentBuildExists exception only.
The API of v3 has already done it.

Change-Id: I2af5aae297c09ed34fadf6520f1a06228624a5a9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/79/75779/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg)
deleted_lines: raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(reason=msg)

commit_message:
Correct inheritance of nova.volume.cinder.API

nova.volume.cinder.API was deriving incorrectly from nova.db.base. This
patch simply removes that unnecessary import and changes
nova.volume.cinder.API to derive from object instead.

Change-Id: I5092b7fbb3780317a09a512aed7ecbe1d57a4428
Closes-bug: #1292997
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/59/80859/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class API(object):
deleted_lines: from nova.db import baseclass API(base.Base):

subject: Remove bad log message in get_remote_image_service
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-16 13:17:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/image/glance.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8d2b250105564bc3288bf01881dfdc7f48012708', 'message': 'Remove bad log message in get_remote_image_service

There was a LOG.debug() message in the
nova.image.glance.get_remote_image_service() call that was incorrect and
misleading:

LOG.debug(_("fetching image %s from glance") % image_href)

This function actually does not fetch any image from Glance -- rather,
it is just used to get the default image service object or an image
service object for use with a remote Glance server.

Change-Id: I2b71c2c52d6593ad4677767a6f2bb40c399fe9eb
Closes-bug: #1292984
'}]
commit_message:
Remove bad log message in get_remote_image_service

There was a LOG.debug() message in the
nova.image.glance.get_remote_image_service() call that was incorrect and
misleading:

LOG.debug(_("fetching image %s from glance") % image_href)

This function actually does not fetch any image from Glance -- rather,
it is just used to get the default image service object or an image
service object for use with a remote Glance server.

Change-Id: I2b71c2c52d6593ad4677767a6f2bb40c399fe9eb
Closes-bug: #1292984

commit_message:
Configure devstack solum to listen on 0.0.0.0

This is because devstack registers the endpoints based on the host_ip set
in localrc and we also use 127.0.0.1 for the trigger test.

Change-Id: Ia940ee455416690680a094eebae0c355e2904593

commit_message:
Fix InstanceNotFound error in _delete_instance_files

Currently the cleanup_running_deleted_instances peroidic task
failed with InstanceNotFound exception, this is because the
db query is not including the deleted instance while
_delete_instance_files() in libvirt driver.

Closes-bug: #1280140

Change-Id: Ie65ff255ad3c582a71db93b07304a21d4976a193
(cherry picked from d835163759527a651f3c4f2109ca0fdc3e968d37)

commit_message:
Return vcpus numbers accounting for cpu_allocation_ratio.

The value of vcpus from hypervisor-show command is the physical cpu number.

Fixes Bug1287722

Change-Id: Iab0966887658c4aad29e4ff6cc9217d35c25f4af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/06/80506/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo.config import cfgcpu_allocation_ratio_opt = cfg.FloatOpt('cpu_allocation_ratio', default=16.0, help='Virtual CPU to physical CPU allocation ratio which affects ' 'all CPU filters. This configuration specifies a global ratio ' 'for CoreFilter. For AggregateCoreFilter, it will fall back to ' 'this configuration value if no per-aggregate setting found.') CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opt(cpu_allocation_ratio_opt) def get_cpu_allocation_ratio(): return CONF.cpu_allocation_ratio if hyp_dict['vcpus']: cpu_allocation_ratio = get_cpu_allocation_ratio() hyp_dict['vcpus'] *= int(cpu_allocation_ratio)

commit_message:
Add get_all and post unit tests for components controller

Change-Id: I311b20974de350654574e5eb2c050b00e0d21133
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/56/79656/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: json_update = {'name': 'update_foo', 'description': 'update_desc_component', 'user_id': 'user_id_test', 'project_id': 'project_id_test'}@mock.patch('pecan.request', new_callable=fakes.FakePecanRequest) @mock.patch('pecan.response', new_callable=fakes.FakePecanResponse) @mock.patch('solum.api.handlers.component_handler.ComponentHandler') class TestComponentsController(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestComponentsController, self).setUp() objects.load() def test_components_get_all(self, handler_mock, resp_mock, request_mock): obj = component.ComponentsController() resp = obj.get_all() self.assertIsNotNone(resp) self.assertEqual(200, resp_mock.status) def test_components_post(self, handler_mock, resp_mock, request_mock): json_create = {'name': 'foo', 'description': 'test_desc_component', 'user_id': 'user_id_test', 'project_id': 'project_id_test'} request_mock.body = json.dumps(json_create) request_mock.content_type = 'application/json' handler_create = handler_mock.return_value.create handler_create.return_value = fakes.FakeComponent() component.ComponentsController().post() handler_create.assert_called_with(json_create) self.assertEqual(201, resp_mock.status) handler_create.assert_called_once_with(json_create) def test_components_post_nodata(self, handler_mock, resp_mock, request_mock): request_mock.body = '' request_mock.content_type = 'application/json' handler_create = handler_mock.return_value.create handler_create.return_value = fakes.FakeComponent() ret_val = component.ComponentsController().post() self.assertEqual("Missing argument: \"data\"", str(ret_val['faultstring'])) self.assertEqual(400, resp_mock.status)
deleted_lines: json_update = {'name': 'fee', 'user_id': 'me'}

Fix as_dict parameter in Component controllers

* Replaced objects.registry.Plan by objects.registry.Component parameter
in as_dict call for ComponentController.put

commit_message:
Add management of assembly dependency in component model

* Renamed assembly_id to assembly_uuid in the api model in order to avoid
confusions between id and uuid
* Added assembly_uuid as _extra_keys in component model

Change-Id: Iedead85db66b46da3837c26a5c36e04fe91ed686

commit_message:
Fixed a problem in iSCSI multipath

Multipathing for attach volume and detach volume operations
doesn't work properly if there are different targets
associated with different portals for a mulitpath device.

Closes-Bug: #1266051
(cherry picked from commit 429ac4dedd617f8c1f7c88dd8ece6b7d2f2accd0)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt_volume.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py

Change-Id: Iab316526cf64de60325d90043f73fa3e83fafb4e

commit_message:
KeyError generated when using a provider template

The function for registering information about provider templates
referenced via urls is causing a KeyError. This patch checks for
checks for the existance of the specified resource befor removing
from the registry. This will prevent KeyErrors in stacks referencing
provider templates that are persisted in the database.

Partial-Bug: #1288541
Change-Id: Id58d5bfeac896d0d52eb4262b25eff3a5fe2238c

commit_message:
VMware Driver update correct disk usage stat

The nodes managed by VMware VCDriver driver can have multiple
datastores (disk abstraction) attached to it. The driver currently
reports the disk usage of a datastore that has the largest capacity.
But it doesn't report a consolidated disk usage. As a result, the
node's storage capability is under-reported in many occassions.

This patch fixes this issue by aggregating the disk freespace,
capacity from all attached datastores.

Closes-Bug: #1220459

Change-Id: I818a041f33a045773fc799de2c69628064ef8cbf

commit_message:
VMware: delete vm snapshot after nova snapshot

When performing a nova snapshot, the vmware driver takes a VM snapshot
and copies out the snapshotted disk. After the operation, the VM
snapshot should be deleted, to prevent growing disk chain(s) on each nova
snapshot.

Closes-Bug: #1252967
Change-Id: I7861ccce0153e45eea0316a2e8dd824210db1660

commit_message:
Correct the state for PAUSED instances on reboot

If an instance is in the PAUSED state before the compute node is
restarted, it will be left in an inconsistent state (impossible to
delete and/or restart it) after the node boots again.

This patch adds a check in the periodic task sync_power_state so when
this situation is detected the instance is stopped and left in a state
from where it can be started again or deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1265494
Change-Id: I7266ace596598522c28a3839091ef50faf4463c2
(cherry picked from commit 6abda5b738c5d801ede3328cf0ec1dc9dddc022f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/40/70940/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif vm_state == vm_states.PAUSED: if vm_power_state in (power_state.SHUTDOWN, power_state.CRASHED): LOG.warn(_("Paused instance shutdown by itself. Calling " "the stop API."), instance=db_instance) try: self.compute_api.force_stop(context, db_instance) except Exception: LOG.exception(_("error during stop() in " "sync_power_state."), instance=db_instance)
deleted_lines: vm_states.PAUSED,

commit_message:
Filter out nonstring environment variables before rules mapping.

Before the requests environment is passed to the RuleProcessor, all
parameters that are not inheriting from the basestring type should
be filtered out.

Change-Id: I469107633abfa86232e1dc1f1bc64605cd888dc2
Closes-bug: #1291981
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/93/80293/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: assertion = dict(self._get_assertion_params_from_env(context)) def _get_assertion_params_from_env(self, context): prefix = CONF.federation.assertion_prefix for k, v in context['environment'].items(): if k.startswith(prefix): yield (k, v)
deleted_lines: assertion = context['environment']

commit_message:
Sync db, db.sqlalchemy from oslo-incubator 0a3436f

This change sync's oslo-incubator's db module from commit hash
0a3436fbcd69b7e0cd1a768be15cbf794c803e3b

$ python update.py --nodeps --base keystone \
    --dest-dir ../keystone \
    --modules db,db.sqlalchemy

This includes a fix where the keystone server would log a warning
that starts with

  This application has not enabled MySQL traditional mode ...

This change includes the following commits from oslo-incubator:

a1a8280 Fix excessive logging from db.sqlalchemy.session
dc2d829 Add lockutils fixture to OpportunisticTestCase
d10f871 Adapt DB provisioning code for CI requirements
5920bed Make db utils importable without migrate
9933bdd Get mysql_sql_mode parameter from config
96a2217 Prevent incorrect usage of _wrap_db_error()
20a7510 Add from_config() method to EngineFacade
fea119e Drop special case for MySQL traditional mode, update unit tests
a584166 Make TRADITIONAL the default SQL mode
5b9e9f4 Fix doc build errors in db.sqlalchemy

The above list was generated by doing the following in oslo-incubator:

 $ git log --oneline --no-merges \
     6ba44fd..0a3436fbcd69b7e0cd1a768be15cbf794c803e3b \
     openstack/common/db/ openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy

The keystone log shows that the last sync was 6ba44fd:

 $ git log -n1 --oneline --no-merges \
     keystone/openstack/common/db \
     keystone/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy
 8f7b87b Sync db, db.sqlalchemy, gettextutils from oslo-incubator 6ba44fd

Closes-Bug: #1271706
Change-Id: If537ff5166b8e9a6fc18c570cdd2e44943faac9c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/29/78429/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default='TRADITIONAL', help='The SQL mode to be used for MySQL sessions. ' 'This option, including the default, overrides any ' 'server-set SQL mode. To use whatever SQL mode ' 'is set by the server configuration, ' 'set this to no value. Example: mysql_sql_mode='),
deleted_lines: help='The SQL mode to be used for MySQL sessions ' '(default is empty, meaning do not override ' 'any server-side SQL mode setting)'),

subject: Make libvirt wait for neutron to confirm plugging before boot
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-19 20:39:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cd59c21b74d258226720d4b485a939c62630b6eb', 'message': 'WIP Make libvirt wait for neutron to confirm plugging before boot

This makes the libvirt driver use the instance event mechanism to
wait for neutron to confirm that VIF plugging is complete before
continuing during spawn (or returning after an interface_attach).

Related to blueprint admin-event-callback-api

Change-Id: I2f771d8bade513d2e54d98a176069011950830aa

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-20 19:02:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/462b854269d0bccb498c6845e9060299e2e30f0a', 'message': 'WIP Make libvirt wait for neutron to confirm plugging before boot

This makes the libvirt driver use the instance event mechanism to
wait for neutron to confirm that VIF plugging is complete before
continuing during spawn (or returning after an interface_attach).

Here we introduce a new configuration option of vif_pluggin_is_fatal
which allows us to control whether a failure to hear back from
neutron is something that should kill the current operation. In
cases where consoles are not provided for the guest, failing is
the only reasonable action, but if consoles *are* provided, it may
be advantageous to still allow the guest to boot and be accessed
out of band.

DocImpact
Related to blueprint admin-event-callback-api

Change-Id: I2f771d8bade513d2e54d98a176069011950830aa

This makes the libvirt driver use the instance event mechanism to
wait for neutron to confirm that VIF plugging is complete before
continuing during spawn (or returning after an interface_attach).

Here we introduce a new configuration option of vif_pluggin_is_fatal
which allows us to control whether a failure to hear back from
neutron is something that should kill the current operation. In
cases where consoles are not provided for the guest, failing is
the only reasonable action, but if consoles *are* provided, it may
be advantageous to still allow the guest to boot and be accessed
out of band.

DocImpact
Related to blueprint admin-event-callback-api

Change-Id: I2f771d8bade513d2e54d98a176069011950830aa

commit_message:
Make libvirt wait for neutron to confirm plugging before boot

This makes the libvirt driver use the instance event mechanism to
wait for neutron to confirm that VIF plugging is complete before
actually starting the VM.

Here we introduce a new configuration option of vif_plugging_is_fatal
which allows us to control whether a failure to hear back from
neutron is something that should kill the current operation. In
cases where consoles are not provided for the guest, failing is
the only reasonable action, but if consoles *are* provided, it may
be advantageous to still allow the guest to boot and be accessed
out of band.

In order to properly reflect the neutron failure in the instance's
fault property, this also extends manager to catch and re-raise
the VirtualInterfaceCreateException during spawn(). Also, since
the oslo.messaging merge, we weren't declaring expected exceptions
for run_instance() which this also fixes.

DocImpact: This requires a neutron that is aware of these events
           when using nova with neutron, or a configuration that
           causes nova not to expect/wait for these events.
Related to blueprint admin-event-callback-api

Change-Id: I2f771d8bade513d2e54d98a176069011950830aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/74832/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if utils.is_neutron(): events = [('vif-plugged', vif['id']) for vif in network_info] else: events = [] try: # FIXME(danms): Perhaps we should use CONF.neutron_url_timeout ? with self.virtapi.wait_for_instance_event(instance, events): for vif in network_info: self.vif_driver.plug(instance, vif) except eventlet.timeout.Timeout: # We never heard from Neutron LOG.warn(_('Timeout waiting for vif plugging callback for ' 'instance %(uuid)s'), {'uuid': instance['uuid']}) raise exception.VirtualInterfaceCreateException()
deleted_lines: for vif in network_info: self.vif_driver.plug(instance, vif)

global requirements today (viz. pexpect, mockito, and

Change-Id: Ie2c00f0edcc6d9fa7acaf0c8b3e712abe9e16c37

commit_message:
Updating global_requirements for trove

Trove needs 3 python packages which don't exist in in the
global requirements today (viz. pexpect, mockito, and
wsgi_intercept). Adding these to the global requirements.

Change-Id: Ie2c00f0edcc6d9fa7acaf0c8b3e712abe9e16c37
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/56/79756/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pexpect>=3.1mockito>=0.5.2wsgi_intercept>=0.6.1

commit_message:
Copyedit Ops Adv Conf chapter

Using the latest copyedits from O'Reilly, address
spelling, grammar and structure in the Ops Adv Conf
chapter of the Ops Guide.

Change-Id: I2565de446534273f00dbaa7fef10aa67b8d7bc58
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/operations-guide refs/changes/50/80750/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Increase volume creation max waiting time
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-14 16:37:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7c11ffacb925ac513190b2ef8f2b2f3f49b61591', 'message': 'Increase volume creation max waiting time

In some cases waiting 60sec, is not enough for cinder volume to be created.
For example, a 20Go LVM volume (hosting a Windows Image) would take 100sec
to be copied assuming a 200Mo/s cinder volume backend.

Issue has already been discussed in I6bcd395a where a config option was
rejected.

This patches raises the max timeout at 180sec by increasing the time
interval between each check. This should also put less pressure on Cinder
API.

Change-Id: I7e739fc20af0ae963269459b5e224c4a8b7bb87d
Partial-Bug: #1253612
Partial-Bug: #1272076

to be copied assuming a 200Mo/s cinder volume backend.

Change-Id: I7e739fc20af0ae963269459b5e224c4a8b7bb87d

commit_message:
Increase volume creation max waiting time

In some cases waiting 60sec, is not enough for cinder volume to be created.
For example, a 20Go LVM volume (hosting a Windows Image) would take 100sec
to be copied assuming a 200Mo/s cinder volume backend.

Issue has already been discussed in I6bcd395a where a config option was
rejected.

This patches raises the max timeout at 180sec.

Change-Id: I7e739fc20af0ae963269459b5e224c4a8b7bb87d
Partial-Bug: #1253612
Partial-Bug: #1272076
